category.name: Networking
category.description: Parameters which affect the Zigbee network

setting.name: Device Role
setting.description: Determine if the device should form or join a network. Sleep must be disabled before CE can be set. Changing CE after association will cause a network leave.

setting.name: Extended PAN ID
setting.description: The preconfigured Extended PAN ID used when forming or joining a network. ID restricts joining to only networks with a matching OP value. If ID is set to 0, the device will attempt to join any open network. When forming a network (CE=1), ID preconfigures the Extended PAN ID used to form the network. When set to 0, a random Extended PAN ID is generated. Changing ID after association will cause a network leave.

setting.name: Zigbee Stack Profile
setting.description: Set/read the Zigbee stack profile setting. ZS must be written to flash; changing ZS and applying the change will automatically execute a WR command and reset the device. 0=Network Specific, 1=ZigBee-2006, 2=Zigbee-PRO

setting.name: PAN Conflict Threshold
setting.description: Set/read threshold for the number of PAN ID conflict reports that must be received by the network manager within one minute to trigger a PAN ID change. If set to zero, detected PAN ID conflicts will not cause a PAN ID change.

setting.name: Node Join Time
setting.description: Set/read the Node Join time. The value of NJ determines the time (in seconds) that the device will allow other devices to join to it.

setting.name: Network Watchdog Timeout
setting.description: Set/read the network watchdog timeout. If set to a non-zero value, the network watchdog timer is enabled on a router. The router will leave the network if is does not receive valid communication within (3 * NW) minutes. The timer is reset each time data is received from or sent to a coordinator, or if a many-to-one broadcast is received.

setting.name: Coordinator Verification
setting.description: If enabled, a joining router will verify a coordinator exists on the same channel after joining or power cycling to ensure it is operating on a valid channel, and will leave if a coordinator cannot be found. If disabled, the router will remain on the same channel through power cycles.

setting.name: Join Notification
setting.description: Set/read the join notification setting. If enabled, the module will transmit a broadcast node identification frame on power up and when joining. This action blinks the Assoc LED rapidly on all devices that receive the data, and sends an API frame out the UART of API devices. This function should be disabled for large networks.

setting.name: Device Options
setting.description: Bitfield of advanced Device Options: Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Reserved Bit 1 - Reserved Bit 2 - Reserved Bit 3 - Reserved Bit 4 - Disable extended timeout Bit 5 - Enable non-acknowledged IO Sampling Bit 6 - Enable High RAM Concentrator Bit 7 - Enable NW to find new network before leaving the network

setting.name: Joining Device Controls
setting.description: Bitfield of options which affect joining devices Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Join using a link key derived from the install code (KY value will be ignored) Bit 1 - Ignore NWK leave requests after joining Bit 2 - Enable Verbose Joining Bit 3 - Join network with best response Bit 4 - Reserved Bit 5 - Allow router or end device to follow the coordinator if a PAN ID change occurs. The Network Watchdog needs to be enabled by setting NW > 0 for this to take effect.

setting.name: Compatibility Options
setting.description: Bitfield of compatibility options. These bits should only be set in networks containing a mixture of XBee 3 and older generation XBee Zigbee modules. Changing C8 after association will cause a network leave. Bitfield options: Bits 0-3 - Reserved Bit 4 - Configure LQI calculations for compatibility with S2C modules.

category.name: Discovery Options
category.description: Configuration of network discovery options

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: A human-friendly node identifier string for this module. This can be up to 20 ASCII characters. This value is returned in a ND query and can be used to easily identify modules.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: The Digi device type identifier value. Can be optionally included in network discoveries and is used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Node Discovery Backoff
setting.description: Sets the backoff delay used to stagger network discovery responses. ND and DN responses occur with a random delay between 0 and NT*100 milliseconds.

setting.name: Node Discovery Options
setting.description: Sets the node discovery options register. Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Append DD value to end of node discovery Bit 1 - Return devices own ND response first

category.name: Operating Network Parameters
category.description: The operational parameters for the attached network

setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: Read the association status code corresponding to the last join attempt. Common status codes: 0x00 - Success 0x21 - Scan found no PANs 0x22 - Scan found no valid PANs based on SC and ID settings 0x23 - Valid PAN found, but joining is currently disabled 0x24 - No joinable beacons were found 0x44 - Secure join - failed to receive new link key 0xAD - Secure Join - A network key was not received from the trust center 0xAF - Secure Join - A preconfigured key is required to join the network 0xFF - Initializing; no status has been determined yet

setting.name: Operating PAN ID
setting.description: Read the operating PAN ID (Zigbee extended PAN ID).

setting.name: Operating 16-bit PAN ID
setting.description: Read the 16-bit operating PAN ID.

setting.name: Operating Channel
setting.description: Read the operating channel number (Uses 802.15.4 channel numbers).

setting.name: Number of Remaining Children
setting.description: Read the number of remaining end device children that can join this device. If NC=0, the device cannot allow any more end device children to join.

category.name: Addressing
category.description: Source and destination addressing settings

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module

setting.name: 16-bit Network Address
setting.description: Read the 16 bit Network Address for the device. 0xFFFE means the device has not joined a PAN.

setting.name: 16-bit Parent Address
setting.description: Read the 16 bit Network Address of the modem's parent. Coordinators and Routers will always show 0xFFFE. An End Device will show its parent's address, or 0xFFFE if it has not yet joined a PAN.

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: Set/read the upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN. 0x0000000000000000 can be used to address the coordinator/network manager.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN. 0x0000000000000000 can be used to address the coordinator/network manager.

setting.name: Transmit Options
setting.description: Set/read Zigbee application layer source transmit options for transparent mode or when the Transmit Options field in an outgoing API transmission is 0: Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Disable retries and route repair Bit 1 - Reserved Bit 2 - Reserved Bit 3 - Reserved Bit 4 - Send packet securely (requires secure session) Bit 5 - Enable APS Encryption (if EE=1) - note this decreases the maximum RF payload by 4 bytes Bit 6 - Use the extended timeout for this destination

setting.name: Maximum Number of Transmission Bytes
setting.description: Read the maximum number of bytes that can be sent in a single unicast transmission. Broadcast RF packets can support 8 more bytes than unicast packets (84 bytes). Fragmentation is utilized on unicast transmissions, increasing payload size to 255 bytes. Refer to the user guide for information regarding payload size limitations.

category.name: Zigbee Configuration
category.description: Parameters which affect outgoing transmissions in a Zigbee network

setting.name: Maximum Hops
setting.description: Set/read the maximum hops limit. This limit sets the maximum number of broadcast hops (BH) and determines the unicast timeout (unicast timeout = (50 * NH) + 100). A unicast timeout of 1.6 seconds (NH=30) is enough time for the data and acknowledgment to traverse about 8 hops.

setting.name: Broadcast Radius
setting.description: Set/Read the transmission radius for broadcast data transmissions. Set to 0 for maximum radius.

setting.name: Many-to-One Route Broadcast Time
setting.description: Set/read the time between aggregation route broadcast times. An aggregation route broadcast creates a route on all devices in the network back to the device that sends the aggregation broadcast. Setting AR to 0xFF disables aggregation route broadcasting. Setting AR to 0 sends one broadcast.

setting.name: Zigbee Source Endpoint
setting.description: Set/read the source endpoint used for transparent data transmissions. This should only be changed if multiple endpoints must be supported.

setting.name: Zigbee Destination Endpoint
setting.description: Set/read the destination endpoint used for transparent data transmissions. This should only be changed if multiple endpoints must be supported.

setting.name: Zigbee Cluster ID
setting.description: Set/read the cluster identifier value used for transparent data transmissions. This should only be changed if multiple cluster IDs must be supported.

category.name: Security
category.description: Set initial security parameters used during form/join. Changing these parameters after association may cause the device to leave the network.

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enable or disable network encryption.

setting.name: Encryption Options
setting.description: Bitfield of encryption options: Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Send/receive NWK keys in the clear (unsecure) Bit 1 - Use Centralized Trust Center Bit 2 - Use EUI64-hashed link keys (centralized TC only) Bit 3 - Emit join notification frames (centralized TC only) Bit 4 - Allow joining using default link keys (unsecure)

setting.name: Link Key
setting.description: Preconfigured Link Key - When queried, KY will return zero if the value of the key is zero; otherwise, for all other values it will give an OK response to indicate a key is present. Trust Center: The global link key of the trust center. If set to 0, registration via 0x24 frame or allowing a default key (EO Bit 4) is required for devices to join. Joining Node: Pre-configured link key. If set to 0, an unsecure default key will be assigned (EO bit 4 must be set on the trust center)

setting.name: Trust Center Network Key
setting.description: Sets network key used for encryption and decryption of network traffic. If set to 0, a random network encryption key will be used(recommended). When queried, NK will return zero if the value of the key is zero; otherwise, for all other values it will give an OK response to indicate a key is present.

setting.name: Trust Center Network Key Rotation Interval
setting.description: Used by a centralized trust center to automatically rotate the network key. This command determines in the interval, in days, in which a new random network key is generated and distributed to the network.

setting.name: Trust Center Link Key Registration Timeout
setting.description: When registering devices to a trust center using a 0x24 API frame, this value determines how long the device will be registered to join.

setting.name: Install Code
setting.description: The install code of the device, used during trust center registration to generate a link key. The Install Code consists of a 128-bit number and 16-bit CCITT CRC (in little endian format).

setting.name: Disable Device Functionality
setting.description: Bitfield of features which can be disabled. Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Reserved Bit 1 - Reserved Bit 2 - Disable OTA Firmware Updates; when set, the device cannot receive an OTA update Bit 3 - Disable SRP authentication on the client side of the connection Bit 4 - Disable SRP authentication on the server side of the connection All reserved and unused option bits must be set to 0

setting.name: OTA Update Server
setting.description: Specifies the 64-bit address of the server the device should use for OTA upgrades. 0: Accept OTA upgrades from any device 0x1-0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFE: Only accept OTA upgrades from a server with the given 64-bit address 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF: Reserved

setting.name: Secure Access Options
setting.description: Bitfield of features that are secured against unauthorized access Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Reserved Bit 1 - Remote AT Commands Bit 2 - Serial Data All reserved and unused option bits must be set to 0

setting.name: Secure Session Authentication
setting.description: Configure Secure Session authentication with a password or an SRP salt/verifier.

category.name: SRP Authentication
category.description: Parameters for authenticating RF communication between two modules

setting.name: SRP Salt
setting.description: 32-bit random value to make attempts to brute force passwords more difficult.

setting.name: Secure Session SRP Verifier (part 1)
setting.description: Most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: Secure Session SRP Verifier (part 2)
setting.description: Second most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: Secure Session SRP Verifier (part 3)
setting.description: Third most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: Secure Session SRP Verifier (part 4)
setting.description: Least significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

category.name: RF Interfacing
category.description: Change RF interface options for 2.4 GHz Zigbee traffic

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: Set the output power level that will be used for outgoing Zigbee transmissions. Query the PP command to determine actual output power.

setting.name: Output power in dBm
setting.description: Read the output power in dBm (as a hex number) that will be used for outgoing transmissions. Negative values will be represented in two's compliment. Example: 0xFB = -5 dBm; 0x13 = +19 dBm

setting.name: Scan Channels
setting.description: Defines the list of channels used during an Active Scan or Energy Detect as a bitfield. Scans are initiated by the AS or ED commands and during Router or End Device Association and Coordinator startup. Changing SC after association may cause a network leave if the operating channel is not included in the mask. Each bit in the mask corresponds to an IEEE 802.15.4 channel: Bit 0 - Channel 11 (0x0B) Bit 2 - Channel 12 (0x0C) ... Bit 15 - Channel 26 (0x1A)

setting.name: Scan Duration
setting.description: Set/read the Scan Duration exponent. The exponent configures the duration of the active scan (PAN scan) on each channel in the SC channel mask when attempting to join a PAN. Scan Time = (SC * (2 ^ SD) * 15.36ms) + (38ms * SC) + 20ms. (SC=# channels)

category.name: MAC Diagnostics
category.description: Media Access Control diagnostic information

setting.name: RSSI of Last Packet
setting.description: Read the magnitude of the RSSI of the last received packet or APS acknowledgment.

setting.name: MAC ACK Failure Count
setting.description: The number of unicast transmissions that timed out awaiting a MAC ACK.

category.name: Sleep Settings
category.description: Configure low power options and enable end device support

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Set/read sleep mode: Pin Hibernate is lowest power, Cyclic Sleep wakes on timer expiration, Cyclic Sleep Pin-Wake wakes on timer expiration or when Sleep_Rq (module pin 9) transitions from a high to a low state. If SM is set to 0, the XBee is a router, otherwise it is an end device.

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: Cyclic sleep period for cyclic sleeping remotes. Set SP on all devices to match SP on End Device children. On routers and coordinators, SP determines the transmission and buffering timeouts when sending a message to a sleeping end device.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: Time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep Mode. The ST parameter is used only with Cyclic Sleep settings (SM=4-5).

setting.name: Number of Cyclic Sleep Periods
setting.description: Number of sleep cycles to elapse before asserting the on/nSleep pin and poll for data on an end device. Parent nodes use SN to define the number of cyclic sleep periods used to calculate end device poll timeout. The poll timeout is calculated in milliseconds as (3 * SN * (SP * 10ms)), minimum of 5 seconds. i.e. if SN=15, SP=0x64, the timeout is 45 seconds.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Set/read sleep options Bitfield options: Bit 1 - Wake for ST time on each cyclic wake after sleeping for SN sleep periods Bit 2 - Enable extended cyclic sleep (sleep for entire SN*SP time - possible data loss) All other option bits should be set to 0.

setting.name: Wake Host
setting.description: Set/read the end device wake host timer value. A non-zero value specifies the time the device should allow after waking from sleep before sending data out the UART (like an IO sample). If serial characters are received, the WH timer is stopped immediately.

setting.name: Poll Rate
setting.description: Set/read the end device poll rate. Setting this to 0 (default) enables polling at 100ms (default rate). Adaptive polling may allow the end device to poll more rapidly for a short time when receiving RF data.

setting.name: Child Table Timeout
setting.description: Sets the Child Table Parent Timeout. This command only set on the SED. The SED sends the timeout to the parent when joining the network.

category.name: MicroPython Options
category.description: Change MicroPython behavior

setting.name: MicroPython Auto Start
setting.description: Configure the module to automatically run compiled MicroPython bytecode stored in flash.

category.name: File System Options
category.description: Configure the device's File System options

setting.name: File System Public Key
setting.description: Configure the device's File System Public Key

setting.name: File System Public Key
setting.description: Configure the device's File System Public Key

category.name: Bluetooth Options
category.description: Change Bluetooth behavior

setting.name: Bluetooth Enable
setting.description: Configure the module to enable Bluetooth.

setting.name: Bluetooth MAC Address
setting.description: Read the module's EUI-48 Bluetooth MAC address

setting.name: Bluetooth Identifier
setting.description: Configure the name that appears in BLE advertisements, up to 22 characters. If set to default (0x20 - ASCII space character), the default name of 'XBee3 Zigbee' will be used. Advanced customization of the BLE advertisement data can be done through the `digi.ble` module in MicroPython.

setting.name: BLE Advertisements Power Level
setting.description: Set the output power level that will be used for Bluetooth Advertisements.

setting.name: Bluetooth Authentication
setting.description: Configure Bluetooth authentication with a password or an SRP salt/verifier.

category.name: Authentication
category.description: Parameters for authenticating Bluetooth API access

setting.name: SRP Salt
setting.description: 32-bit random value to make attempts to brute force passwords more difficult.

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 1)
setting.description: Most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 2)
setting.description: Second most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 3)
setting.description: Third most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 4)
setting.description: Least significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

category.name: API Configuration
category.description: Change API mode configuration

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: The API mode setting. RF Packets received can be formatted into API frames to be sent out the serial port. When API is enabled the serial data must be formatted as API frames as transparent mode is disabled.

setting.name: API Output Mode
setting.description: Set the API output mode for received API frames. If AO > 0, the output frame format will be 0x91 when operating in API mode: Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Output in Native/Explicit API format Bit 1 - Supported ZDO request pass-through Bit 2 - Unsupported ZDO request pass-through Bit 3 - Binding request pass-through Bit 4 - Echo received supported ZDO requests out the serial port Bit 5 - Suppress all ZDO messages from being sent out the serial port and disable pass-through

setting.name: Extended API Options
setting.description: Optionally output additional messages that would normally be masked by the XBee application. The bits in this parameter are used to enable different kinds of normally-suppressed output: Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Reserved Bit 1 - Output receive frames for client-side OTA update commands Bit 2 - Reserved Bit 3 - Output Extended Modem Status (0x98) frames instead of Modem Status (0x8A) frames when a Secure Session status change occurs

category.name: UART Interface
category.description: Configuration options for UART

setting.name: UART Baud Rate
setting.description: The serial interface baud rate for communication between the serial port of the module and the host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window.

setting.name: UART Parity
setting.description: The parity for the UART.

setting.name: UART Stop Bits
setting.description: Configure the number of stop bits that the UART will output.

setting.name: Transparent Packetization Timeout
setting.description: The number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins when operating in transparent mode (AP=0). Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

category.name: AT Command Options
category.description: Change AT Command Mode Behavior. Command mode is only accessible via the UART.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: The character value used to enter command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character. It must be entered three times within the guard time to enter command mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: The command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, module returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: The required period of silence before, after, and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

category.name: UART Pin Configuration
category.description: Pin configuration for the UART interface

setting.name: DIO6/RTS Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6/RTS line of the module. TH pin 16 Options include: RTS flow control Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO7/CTS Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7/CTS line of the module. TH pin 12 Options include: CTS flow control Digital input Digital output RS-485 control

setting.name: DIO13/UART_DOUT Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO13 line of the module. TH pin 2 Options include: UART DOUT Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO14/UART_DIN Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO14/UART_DIN line of the module. TH pin 3 Options include: UART DIN Digital input Digital output

category.name: I/O Settings
category.description: Modify DIO and ADC options

setting.name: DIO0/AD0/Commissioning Button Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD0/DIO0/Commissioning line of the module. TH Pin 20 Options include: Commissioning button ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO1/AD1/SPI_nATTN Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD1/DIO1/SPI_nATTN line of the module. TH pin 19 Options include: SPI_nATTN on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO2/AD2/SPI_CLK Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD2/DIO2/SPI_CLK line of the module. TH pin 18 Options include: SPI_CLK on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO3/AD3/SPI_nSSEL Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module. TH pin 17 Options include: SPI_nSSEL on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO4/SPI_MOSI Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO4/SPI_MOSI line of the module. TH pin 11 Options include: SPI_MOSI on TH variant Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO5/Association LED Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO5/Assoc line of the module. TH pin 15 Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO8/DTR/Sleep_Rq Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO8 line of the module. TH pin 9 Options include: Sleep Request/DTR (used with pin hibernate and pin wake) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO9/Sleep Indicator Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO9 line of the module. TH pin 13 Options include: Awake/nSleep indicator (pin is LOW when module is asleep) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO10/PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO10/PWM0 line of the module. M0 controls the PWM duty cycle when configured as a PWM output. TH pin 6 Options include: RSSI PWM output PWM output Digital Input and Output

setting.name: DIO11 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO11/PWM1 line of the module. M1 controls the PWM duty cycle when configured as a PWM output. TH pin 7 Options include: PWM output Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO12/SPI_MISO Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO12/SPI_MISO line of the module. TH pin 4 Options include: SPI_MISO on TH variant Digital input Digital output

setting.name: Pull-up Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pullup resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pullup enabled, 0=no internal pullup. Bitfield options: Bit 0 - DIO4 | TH Pin 11 Bit 1 - DIO3 | TH Pin 17 Bit 2 - DIO2 | TH Pin 18 Bit 3 - DIO1 | TH Pin 19 Bit 4 - DIO0 | TH Pin 20 Bit 5 - DIO6 | TH Pin 16 Bit 6 - DIO8 | TH Pin 9 Bit 7 - DIO14 | TH Pin 3 Bit 8 - DIO5 | TH Pin 15 Bit 9 - DIO9 | TH Pin 13 Bit 10 - DIO12 | TH Pin 4 Bit 11 - DIO10 | TH Pin 6 Bit 12 - DIO11 | TH Pin 7 Bit 13 - DIO7 | TH Pin 12 Bit 14 - DIO13 | TH Pin 2

setting.name: Pull-up/down Direction
setting.description: Set/read bitfield for resistor direction (1=pullup, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command.

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: Set PWM0 Duty cycle. The PWM period is 64 us theres are 0x3FF (1023 decimal) steps within this period. Example M0=0 (0% PWM), 0x1FF (50% PWM), 0x3FF (100% PWM)

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: Set PWM1 Duty cycle. The PWM period is 64 us theres are 0x3FF (1023 decimal) steps within this period. Example M1=0 (0% PWM), 0x1FF (50% PWM), 0x3FF (100% PWM)

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: Set/read the Associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Set/read PWM timer register. Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI pin (P6). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet or APS acknowledgment and is shut off when the timer expires.

category.name: I/O Sampling
category.description: Configure IO sampling parameters

setting.name: IO Sampling Rate
setting.description: Set the IO sampling rate to enable periodic sampling. If set >0, all enabled digital IO and analog inputs will be sampled and transmitted every IR milliseconds. IO Samples are transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

setting.name: Digital IO Change Detection
setting.description: Bitfield that configures which digital input pins should be monitored for change detection. If a change is detected on an enabled digital input pin, a digital IO sample is immediately transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL. Bitfield options: Bit 0 - DIO0 Bit 1 - DIO1 Bit 2 - DIO2 Bit 3 - DIO3 Bit 4 - DIO4 Bit 5 - DIO5 Bit 6 - DIO6 Bit 7 - DIO7 Bit 8 - DIO8 Bit 9 - DIO9 Bit 10 - DIO10 Bit 11 - DIO11 Bit 12 - DIO12 Bit 13 - DIO13 Bit 14 - DIO14

setting.name: Analog Voltage Reference
setting.description: The analog voltage reference used for A/D sampling.

setting.name: Supply Voltage High Threshold
setting.description: Configure the supply voltage high threshold. If the supply voltage measurement equals or drops below this threshold, the supply voltage will be appended to an IO sample transmission.

category.name: Location
category.description: User-defined parameters used to store the physical location of the deployed device.

setting.name: Location X - Latitude
setting.description: User-defined GPS latitude coordinates of the node that is displayed on Digi Remote Manager and Network Assistant.

setting.name: Location Y - Longitude
setting.description: User-defined GPS longitude coordinates of the node that is displayed on Digi Remote Manager and Network Assistant.

setting.name: Location Z - Elevation
setting.description: User-defined GPS elevation of the node that is displayed on Digi Remote Manager and Network Assistant.

category.name: Diagnostics - Firmware/Hardware Information
category.description: Information about the XBee hardware and firmware

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read modem firmware version number.

setting.name: Bootloader Version
setting.description: Display the Bootloader version

setting.name: Extended version information
setting.description: Shows detailed version information, device type, time stamp for the build, stack version, and bootloader version.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read modem hardware version number.

setting.name: Hardware/Firmware Compatibility
setting.description: Specifies what firmware is compatible with this radio. Firmware with a compatibility value lower than the value returned by %C cannot be loaded onto the board.

setting.name: Power Variant
setting.description: Specifies if the radio is a PRO or Non-PRO variant. 0 = PRO, 1 = Non-PRO

setting.name: Supply Voltage
setting.description: Read the supply voltage of the module in mV units.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: Read power compensation temperature sensor in units of Celsius degrees.

setting.name: Configuration Checksum
setting.description: The CRC of the current settings. The purpose of this command is to allow the detection of an unexpected configuration change on a device. After a firmware update this command may return a different value.
